qas.question: What metric indicates a lights ability to make object appear natural?

context: To define light source color properties, the lighting industry predominantly relies on two metrics, <a0_0>correlated color temperature<a0_0/> (<a3_0>CCT<a3_0/>), commonly used as an indication of the apparent "warmth" or "coolness" of the light emitted by a source, and <a1_0>color rendering index<a1_0/> (<a2_0>CRI<a2_0/>), an indication of the light source’s ability to make objects appear natural.
